summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel discussing discrepancies in the inventory of digital evidence seized from the New York and Virgin Islands search warrants in the Epstein case. The correspondence focuses on missing thumb drives, iPads, and an iPhone, and the status of their forensic processing.

persons.name: Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: The primary author of the email, discussing the status of digital evidence processing, including thumb drives, iPads, and an iPhone from the Epstein case search warrants.

persons.name: NYO CART Coordinator
persons.context: The sign-off title used by the Senior Forensic Examiner in the email, indicating their role as the NYO Computer Analysis Response Team Coordinator.

connections.description: The Senior Forensic Examiner references receiving a spreadsheet from M to help reconcile evidence inventory.

events.title: Evidence Inventory Discrepancy Discussion
events.description: FBI personnel exchange emails to resolve discrepancies in the inventory list of digital evidence seized from New York and Virgin Islands search warrants related to the Epstein case.

keyFacts: A 4 GB thumb drive (evidence item 1839) from the Epstein case did not image properly during forensic processing.
Evidence items 1B38, 39, & 40 have been checked back into evidence and verified in the Sentinel system.
Items 1638 & 40 are listed under 'Island evidence' and were processed with the Island Windows machines.
There are 6 iPads in evidence; all but one (1B69) have been unlocked and processed.
An iPhone 5 (evidence item 1B55) is at an unspecified location ('lIQ') for unlocking.
